column1: All morning there had been a little gathering of people outside the gate. The funeral coach came
column2: and a very small thing was placed in it and covered with flowers. One plant of the wallflower in the garden would have covered it. The coach took the road to Dorking
column4: and in a moment or two all seemed silent and deserted
column7: and Box Hill. The cottage was not deserted
column8: as they knew who now trooped into the round in front of it
column9: their eyes on the closed door. They were the mighty company
column11: — Lucy and Clara and Rhoda and Diana and Rose and old Mel and Roy Richmond and Adrian and Sir Willoughby and a hundred others
column12: and they stood in line against the box-wood
column13: waiting for him to come out. Each of his women carried a flower
column14: and the hands of all his men were ready for the salute.
